csks.headerTitle: What is a Cardano Starter Kit?
csks.headerSubtitle: And how do you make one?
csks.headerText: Here is an outline of our thinking behind CSKs. In collaboration with other builders, we are creating support resources for more people to contribute expertise to the Gimbalabs community.

csks.headerSubtitle: Securing a Wallet, Getting ADA and Staking on the Cardano Blockchain
csks.headerText: Keep your recovery phrase close, investigate the options for ADA wallets, for buying ADA on exchanges, and for staking.

csks.headerSubtitle: Getting started with GitHub and the Marlowe Playground
csks.headerText: Navigate GitHub and leave your mark. Test a 'bad bet' by playing with the Marlowe Blockly editor.

csks.headerSubtitle: How to talk about the Cardano Blockchain with your friends and family
csks.headerText: Think like a teacher and apply some education concepts to the project of Cardano adoption. Investigate the Marlowe Playground to prepare for eventual applications of Cardano in the real world.

csks.headerSubtitle: Where does blockchain fit in the development stack?
csks.headerText: This starter kit provides background knowledge for anyone considering learning web development as a step towards building on new ideas.
Curious about how transaction metadata works on Cardano? Come investigate what tx metadata looks like and our hack for posting text strings to the blockchain.

csks.headerSubtitle: The Gimbalabs Local ADA Spending Challenge
csks.headerText: You should take a look at this Cardano Starter Kit if you are curious about how tokens work...and if you want to contribute to the historic roll out of Cardano!
